summary: This document is a chain of emails from July-August 2020 between the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) and the Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG). The emails discuss coordinating a call regarding victims and document collection related to the Epstein/Maxwell case, specifically referencing the SDFL (Southern District of Florida) investigation, the NPA (Non-Prosecution Agreement), and CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) litigation.

connections.description: Both are correspondents from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) working on the Epstein/Maxwell case, coordinating communication with the ODAG.

events.title: Scheduled Call on Epstein/Maxwell
events.description: A phone call is scheduled for 10 AM between the USANYS and ODAG to discuss victims and document collection related to the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Previous Call Scheduled
events.description: A call was previously scheduled for noon on July 23, 2020, between USANYS and ODAG regarding document location issues for the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Initial Outreach Regarding Maxwell Charges
events.description: The USANYS reaches out to the ODAG to revisit conversations about document/discovery requests, noting that Ghislaine Maxwell has been recently charged.

locations: Office of the Deputy Attorney General (ODAG)
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) was actively investigating Ghislaine Maxwell as of August 2020, following her recent charges.
Prosecutors were seeking to obtain hard-copy materials from the Southern District of Florida (SDFL) related to the Epstein investigation and the prior Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA).
The correspondence references prior CVRA (Crime Victims' Rights Act) litigation and a significant document collection effort by OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) the previous year.
The primary purpose of the communication was to coordinate inter-office contact for document collection and discuss issues related to victims in the Maxwell case.
